frqParts.text: Write your answers in the spaces provided. Refer to the figure or diagram to answer the question. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples. The graph shows the percentage of electricity produced by nuclear energy in various countries from 1960 to 2015. (a) Based on the information in the graph, describe the trend in the percentage of electricity produced using nuclear energy in Japan between 2000 and 2015.

(b) Based on the information in the graph, identify the most recent year in which the United States, Germany, and Japan each produced approximately the same percentage of their electricity from nuclear energy.

(c) Throughout the 1990s, France used about half as much nuclear fuel as did the United States. Explain how France could have used half as much nuclear fuel as the United States when the graph is showing a large difference between the two countries.

(d) Researchers state that the 1979 partial meltdown at Three Mile Island in the United States had a significant impact on nuclear power generation in the United States after the event. Make a claim that supports or refutes this statement based on evidence in the graph.

Electrical production in the United States is typically produced in a power plant but can also be supplemented by renewable sources of energy as well.(e) Describe why pairing solar energy with energy from natural gas makes this renewable source a more viable method of electrical production for more United States consumers.
(f) In some areas, cracks in the foundation of homes may allow naturally occurring air pollutants to enter a home. Identify an indoor air pollutant that could increase under these circumstances.

Urban forests, green roofs, parks, and other green spaces can improve environmental conditions for city dwellers in a number of ways.(g) In addition to improving water quality and reducing energy usage in cities, increasing the amount of vegetation can improve air quality. Describe one way increasing the amount of vegetation in cities can lead to cleaner air.
(h) Describe one ecological benefit that may result from increasing the amount of vegetation in cities.
